for response of specific function supported by the server :param function_name: the name of the function - string :param arguments: arguments required by the functions in a form of a list :return: the result of the function call or Fault Error or Protocol Error

get_request_to_url(data)[source]¶

uses GET method to retrieve a URL :param data: parameters of the URL - ‘dict’ type :raises HTTPError: when the specified URL is not found :raises TypeError: when the data passed is in wrong format

post_request_to_url(data)[source]¶

uses POST method to retrieve a URL :param data: parameters of the URL - ‘dict’ type :raises HTTPError: when the specified URL is not found :raises TypeError: when the data passed is in wrong format

reads the data from the url :param num_bytes: number of bytes that needs to be read

returns the server address for the server created :return: the server address - str

starts the server for handling single request only shuts down after the request has been handled

start_server_for_forever(poll_interval=0.5)[source]¶

starts the server for handling infinite requests shuts down only after a keyboard interrupt is performed :param poll_interval: the time interval after which the shut-down request will be polled

net_and_server_utils.ssl_socket module¶

API to implement a network service involving sockets where servers and clients authenticate themselves and encrypt the transmitted data using SSL

class net_and_server_utils.ssl_socket.SSLSocketClient[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for creating client using SSL sockets

communicate()[source]¶

for communicating with the server and printing the response

communicate_and_save(filename)[source]¶

communicates with the server and saves the response to a file :param filename: the name of file where the response needs to be stored

connect_to_server(server_hostname, port_number)[source]¶

connects to the desired server :param server_hostname: host name of the server :param port_number: port number on which server is listening :raises SSLCertVerificationError - when the SSL certificate cannot be verified

default_context_creation()[source]¶

creates the context with default configuration

bind_and_listen(hostname, port)[source]¶

binds the server with the host name and starts listening to requests :param hostname: host name/address of the server :param port: port number on which server needs to be run

create_context(certificate_file, private_key_file)[source]¶

creates context with default configuration :param certificate_file: location of server’s certificate file :param private_key_file: location of server’s private key file
